labels.analysis: The MCP Server "Jina Reader" is designed to fetch and convert content from a remote URL into Markdown format. It solves the problem of retrieving structured content from the web in a format that is easily readable and modifiable, particularly useful for content creators, researchers, or developers who need to process web content programmatically.
labels.reasoning: The primary function of the server is to retrieve and transform web content, which aligns well with the "Web Search & Research" category. As a secondary label, "Content Creation" is relevant due to its utility in transforming web content into a more editable and structured format. There is no unique functionality that warrants a custom label.

tools.name: fetch_url_content
tools.description: Fetch the content of a URL as Markdown.

server_info_crawled.name: Jina Reader MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: mcp-jina-reader
server_info_crawled.overview: Fetch the content of a remote URL as Markdown with Jina Reader

tools.name: fetch_url_content
tools.description: Fetch the content of a URL as Markdown.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/mcp-jina-reader/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
